meanings.definition: Gradually reduce or write off the cost or value of an asset over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: She amortized the loan by making monthly payments.
meanings.sent2: The company amortized the equipment cost over five years.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he would amortize the pizza by eating one slice a day.
meanings.sent4: The sunset seemed to amortize the sky, painting it with warm hues.
meanings.sent5: The slow erosion of the rocks amortized the landscape into a beautiful formation.

meanings.definition: Pay off a debt with regular payments.
meanings.sent1: They amortized their mortgage by paying a fixed amount each month.
meanings.sent2: The student loan was amortized over a ten-year period.
meanings.sent3: She playfully said she would amortize her ice cream debt by sharing with friends.
meanings.sent4: The hard work and dedication amortized his financial struggles.
meanings.sent5: The consistent savings plan helped amortize their debts and build a secure future.
